query: Use a horizontal bar chart to show the number of movies in each genre, sorted from lowest to highest count.
Use a line chart to show the average rating by year.
Use a point chart to show the relationship between Runtime (Minutes) and Rating.
Use an area chart to show how the total number of movies released each year has changed over time.
Use a rect (heatmap) to show the average rating for each combination of Genre and Year.
Use an arc chart to show the share of movies by genre.
Use a boxplot to show the distribution of movie ratings for each genre.
Use a bar chart to show the total revenue for each genre, sorted from highest to lowest, including only movies released after 2000.
Use a point chart to show the relationship between Rating and Revenue (Millions).
Use a line chart to show the number of movies released each year, with a separate line for each genre.
